bioghist.p: Alan Graham MacDiarmid ONZ (b.1927) is Blanchard Professor of Chemistry at the University of Pennsylvania and James Von Ehr Chair of Science and Technology at the University of Texas, Dallas. In 2000 he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his work on conductive polymers, more commonly known as "synthetic metals." In 2001 he was awarded the Order of New Zealand. He studied at Victoria University of Wellington (New Zealand), and holds Ph.D.s from the University of Wisconsin and the University of Cambridge.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of MacDiarmid's correspondence, reprints, University of Pennsylvania files and research files. Records include: documentation of lectures, conferences, and honors ceremonies; correspondence (emails, letters, and telephone messages) with colleagues, students, and friends; copies of students' work; committee paperwork; lecture notes, texts, and overhead sheets; research notes, graphs, and diagrams; correspondence, itineraries, letters of congratulation, publicity, and other documents related to the Nobel Prize; reprints of MacDiarmid's articles and those of others; and other miscellaneous papers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
